result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Howard Earl Watterson

defendant.name: Watterson, Howard Earl

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report
Maintain absolute sobriety. No intentional contact with B.W., K.F.F. or their children.

3:31 PM Defendant Howard Earl Watterson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Shanna Sanders appeared by video for Howard Earl Watterson.  Prosecuting attorney David S Olson and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant address and date of birth verified. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond set of $1000 with conditions. Maintain absolute sobriety. No intentional contact with B.W., K.F.F. or their children.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
